items.content_html:
In my opinion, Object.prototype.__noSuchMethod__, Object.prototype.unwatch(), and Object.prototype.watch() in Object page should be removed.

Reasons being that the links are broken due to the pages being archived, there is a better alternative like Proxy, and they still can access the pages at Archived JavaScript Reference.

items.title: Fixed YouTube video ID

items.content_html:
The json() method of the Body mixin takes a Response stream and reads it to completion. It returns a promise that resolves with the result of parsing the body text as JSON.

can read like "It returns a promise that resolves ... as JSON"

but in fact, it means "It returns a promise that resolves with (the result of parsing the body text as JSON)"

So it is: by parsing the body text as JSON, return the result in the form of a JavaScript object.

It is mentioned as such down below the docs, but the title can give people wrong impressions that it is returning "JSON".

There are so many places where people think it is "JSON", when it is JavaScript object.

https://github.com/mdn/fetch-examples/blob/e59e035214d21926eb7fc474e0cea88b33199b00/fetch-json/index.html

and the pull request to correct it: mdn/fetch-examples#16

https://jsonplaceholder.typicode.com/

fetch('https://jsonplaceholder.typicode.com/todos/1')
  .then(response => response.json())
  .then(json => console.log(json))

You see, we have a string s, we use parseInt(s) to get back an integer. We would not call that integer a string, would we?

So, we have JSON, we use .json() to parse it and get back a JavaScript object, and we call this JavaScript object a "JSON". That is very wrong.

items.title: It is very confusing

items.content_html:
gyronorm.js is not maintained anymore, so replaced it with parallax.

Dear All, It has been almost 5 years since I first wrote this library. In the mean time JS evolved a lot; and parallel to this I grow apart from the JS world. Therefore I dont have the resources to go on maintaining this library and make sure it runs as expercted on latest devices. Gyronorm library will stay opensource in GitHub however I wont be merging any PR; and I wont look actively into any issues. I created an issue for alternatives here: dorukeker/gyronorm.js#61 So if any one finds an up-to-date alternative please feel free to share it. Cheers!
items.title: replaced obsolete gyronorm.js with parallax

items.content_html:
Move https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DocumentOrShadowRoot/elementFromPoint to http://localhost:3000/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/elementFromPoint

Move https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/DocumentOrShadowRoot/elementsFromPoint to
http://localhost:3000/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/elementsFromPoint

The spec defines both for Document only: https://drafts.csswg.org/cssom-view/#extensions-to-the-document-interface

Apparently browsers decided to also ship this for ShadowRoot. I'll write a follow-up PR to document the non-standard methods, too. This gets rid of the mixin pages for a start.
items.title: Move DocumentOrShadowRoot.element(s)FromPoint to Document.element(s)FromPoint
